title.native: これはゾンビですか？オブ・ザ・デッド
title.romaji: Kore wa Zombie desu ka? of the Dead
title.english: Is this A Zombie? of the Dead

description:
Aikawa Ayumu was revived as a zombie by the cute necromancer Eucliwood Hellscythe. After the zany, madcap adventures in the first season of Is This a Zombie? ended, Ayumu thought his life might finally get back to normal, or as normal as it can be for a zombie. However, destiny has other plans for him. Some guys just can't catch a break.

(Source: FUNimation)
synonyms: Kore wa Zombie Desu ka? Jigoku-hen

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

name.native: ユークリウッド・ヘルサイズ
ネグレリア・ネビロス
サラスバティ, 星川 輝羅々

node.description:
__Hometown:__ Kitami, Hokkaido, Japan

[Official blog](https://ameblo.jp/c-kitaoka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiharu_kitaoka)

Kitaoka made her voice acting debut in [Kiddy Girl-and](https://anilist.co/anime/3349/) under the stage name Aya Gouda. She went on to use that name until she left the Production Ace agency in September 2012.

On March 27, 2016, she announced her marriage and her retirement from voice acting in a blog post. She is currently a voice acting instructor at Sapporo Broadcasting Arts College.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)
Debuted as an art director of [Kurau Phantom Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/483/).

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
